This doesn't look related to my change, but rather to the fact that `datetime_data` is seemingly broken
I think `array_datetime_data` must DECREF `dtype` later, so that would explain why a seemingly unrelated change can make it break reliably probably.
OK, I tried and it fixes things. Will just push a commit here, I hope you do not mind.
Nice find! I suspect my mistake was using an exotic dtype that isn't really used much, combined with the fact that the dtype itself was ephemeral.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +59,63 @@    def test_datetime(self):
        dt = np.datetime64('2000-01', ('M', 2))
        assert np.datetime_data(dt) == ('M', 2)

        with pytest.raises(TypeError):
